events.title: Ferdinand Magellan's Expedition Begins
events.description: Ferdinand Magellan sets sail from Spain with five ships to find a western sea route to the Spice Islands, initiating the first circumnavigation of the Earth.
events.significance: This voyage demonstrated the full extent of the Earth and paved the way for global maritime exploration and trade.

events.title: Capture of Rome
events.description: Italian troops breach the Aurelian Walls at Porta Pia, leading to the capture of Rome and the final unification of Italy under the Kingdom of Italy.
events.significance: This event marked the end of the Papal States and solidified Rome as the capital of a unified Italy.

events.title: The Billie Jean King vs. Bobby Riggs 'Battle of the Sexes' Tennis Match
events.description: Tennis champion Billie Jean King defeats Bobby Riggs in a highly publicized and symbolic match promoting gender equality in sports.
events.significance: The match was a milestone for women's sports and the women's rights movement, highlighting gender equality and women's empowerment.

events.title: First Cannes Film Festival
events.description: The inaugural Cannes Film Festival takes place in France, becoming one of the most prestigious and influential film festivals in the world.
events.significance: It established a major international platform for celebrating and promoting global cinema.
